column4: Ubuntu is not recognizing my wireless card. Can someone help please?
Ubuntu is not recognizing my wireless card. Can someone help please?
first I'd do an update
just to get the latest
I've already updated. Are you talking about a specific update?
nope, just to get the latest.. now what I'd try is go to hardware drivers
it should say your card.. but um
I haven't had many driver issues actually..ever.
ok let me look
I have an alternate atheros madwifi driver and it is activated
its defective on my ver of ubuntu, after I de-activated it, it wa fine again
ok I'll try that, did you have to do a restart for it to start working
do you have to do a restart before it will work?
yes.
ok thanks!
preferences -> mouse, touchpad, enable mouse clicks with touchpad (this usually solves the problem, IF that is what it is)
ok I'll try that
that didn't work, the wireless still won't log on to my network
no no I just meant so it doesn't add random characters..
like you want to put in your password but it adds stuff you didn't type right
no I put in the correct password and it won't log on, so I checked to make sure I typed the password correctly and it showed up as random numbers and letters
do you know of a solution to this
